Length Units

Absolute length units:

These units are literal representations of the measurements in the phsyical world. The catch is that they can differ on various screens. They are good for printed documents; however, they are not good for designing and developing websites.

  • cm = centimeters
  • mm = millimeters
  • in = inches
  • px = 1/96th of an inch *
  • pt = 1/72nd of an inch
  • pc = 12 pt or 1/6th of an inch

* px is equal to one pixel on the screen and is the most useful as it is relative to the viewing device

Relative length units

These are not fixed values; they are relative to another predefined value

  • ex = the height of the lower-case 'x' of that font (1/2 of an em); therefore, it changes with the font
  • ch = the width of the zero character of that font
  • em = the font size of the base or parent element
  • rem = always equal to the font size of the root element

Example:

The font size of this div element is 24px.
This span element, which is inside the div element, is set at 0.75em, which translates to 18px.

Viewport-percentage lengths

Units based on the height and width of the viewport (screen)

  • vw = 1/100th of the viewport width (value remains consistent for all elements)
  • vh = same as vw, but for height
  • vmin = value equals the smallest length (ex: if the dimensions are 1200x800, the value will be 8px)
  • vmax = same as vmin, but the largest length
  • percentages = based on the length of the same property of the parent element

Examples:

This element's font size is set at 2vw. If you resize the browser's width, you will see the font size change.
This element's font size is set at 2vh. If you resize the browser's height, you will see the font size change.

* Notice how 2vh and 2vw are only equal if the browser is set as a square.

This element's font size is set at 2vmin. If you resize the browser's height and width, you will see the font size change according to which dimension is smaller.
This element's font size is set at 2max. If you resize the browser's height and width, you will see the font size change according to which dimension is larger.

* Notice how 2vmin and 2vmax are only equal if the browser is set as a square.
